comments.body: Could you please elaborate more about this ?

@Akasurde So when I was adding this module, I found it surprising that I needed to make the change here in `module_utils/ipa.py`. I thought that _maybe_ we could do a better job with the function implementation so that we didn't have to add "exceptions"/"switch statements" for certain API methods like how we're doing now.

I honestly didn't think too much more about it than that, and just added that comment. :-)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +99,103 @@        data = dict(method=method)

        # TODO: We should probably handle this a little better.
        if method in ('ping', 'config_show'):
            data['params'] = [[], {}]

comments.body: Is there a good reason to make this "private"? Seems as though a callback from args should be public.

well... It's semi-private, since I only used one underscore and not two. And did it so, since this is the only module where this function is called from. If you think I should remove the leading underscore, I can remove it.
Please do not override existing KRB5CCNAME. You should only use MEMORY: ccaches if no KRB5CCNAME is defined in the environment already.
Good call! Let me update this.
Updated it. Does this make sense?

            ccache = "MEMORY:" + str(uuid.uuid4())
            os.environ['KRB5CCNAME'] = ccache
            self.use_gssapi = True
